column4: I tried modprobe -r snd-hda-intel, and it says Module snd_hda_intel is in use. How do I know what is using it?
lsmod | grep snd_hda_intel
sorry, backwards thinking, that shows whats being used by snd-hda-intel
I got this http://www.nomorepasting.com/getpaste.php?pasteid=9296
I was thinking backwards, that shows what's being used by snd-hda-intel , sorry
Okay so what else can I do other than restarting GDM
what are you trying to accomplish? removing modules isn't really a recommended thing
and I don't think restarting gdm wouldn't be enough, to answer your question
My sound is not working in Cedega. Whenever this happens, I stop gdm, remove the module and add it again, and start gdm. But I wanna do it without stopping gdm each time
I think file-roller supports zip; anyway xarchive does , if you have p7zip-fill installed iirc
I need for .rar files, not .zip
er, that was 7zip with file-roller
then install unrar , file-roller will use it also
you should probably explore system->admin->synaptic , it references more software than add/remove
it says I have file-roller already installed..
install unrar , then doubleclick an rar file
Okay, that's archive manager.. I need something else. It shows an error in some rar files
have you installed unrar yet?
yes
ah, then try the p7zip-full
or   rar e <file>
they are .r01 .r02 .r03 etc
